thread.title: Texas & Neighbors: Crystal Bridges adds Frank Lloyd Wright home
thread.title_full: Texas & Neighbors: Crystal Bridges adds Frank Lloyd Wright home | Dallas Morning News

author: MARY DUNKLIN
title: Texas & Neighbors: Crystal Bridges adds Frank Lloyd Wright home
text:
BENTONVILLE, ARK. Crystal Bridges museum plans to add house by Frank Lloyd Wright A home designed by architect Frank Lloyd Wright that was moved from New Jersey will open to the public at Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art on Nov. 11.
The Bachman-Wilson house, which was acquired in 2013, is being reassembled at the museum in Bentonville, Ark.
The structure is an example of Wright’s Usonian style, residential architecture that was simpler and lower-cost than his elaborate, highly customized homes.
Admission is free. Hours are 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Monday; 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. Wednesday, Thursday and Friday; 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. Closed Tuesdays.
Beginning Nov. 2, reserve tickets online or at 479-657-2335. Hourlong guided tours will be offered five days per week (no tours Tuesday or Friday).
Contact: 479-418-5700; crystalbridges.org/architecture/frank-lloyd-wrig ht
HILL COUNTRY Monthlong pass lets visitors sample multiple wineries Save money and enjoy local beverages on the Texas Wine Month Trail during October. This year almost 50 wineries, including Becker Vineyards and Messina Hof, are participating.
A ticket, valid all month, includes a full tasting at each winery and a discount on purchases. Tickets are $60 per couple or $35 per individual, with a limit of four winery visits a day.
Need something fun for the kids to do while you’re drinking wine? Consider the Hill Country Science Mill Rocketry Day Camp created just for Texas Wine Month. It’s 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 10 and 24 and is suitable for children in fourth through eighth grades. Cost is $45 per session, which includes box lunch and snack.
Contact: texaswinetrail.com/trails; sciencemill.org/camps-classes/rocketry-day-camp
LAROSE, LA. Cajun offerings will be plentiful at French Food Fest Lovers of Cajun food should make plans to visit French Food Fest, Oct. 22-25 in Larose, La., about an hour southwest of New Orleans.
Multiple vendors, including local restaurants, will help attendees indulge their Cajun cravings and an on-site market will offer take-home specialties.
Also planned: live music, including rock band .38 Special on Thursday night. Other family-friendly events include a carnival with games, petting zoo and 3-on-3 basketball tournament.
Free parking and entry.
Contact: frenchfoodfest.com
RIO RANCHO, N.M. Boxtoberfest challenges athletes with creative contests Athletes of all abilities can challenge themselves during Boxtoberfest on Oct. 24 and 25 in Rio Rancho, N.M. The weekend event draws an estimated 2,500 participants, volunteers and spectators.
There will be up to five individual events that incorporate strength, conditioning and skill. Athletes do not know what their events will be until a week prior to competition. Previous events have included gymnastics, swimming with weighted diving bricks, sled races, Olympic weightlifting and cross-country running. Teams and athletes with the best performances will win awards.
Entry fee is $75 per participant.
Travel tip: The Rio Rancho Convention and Visitors Bureau has discount rates on hotels for out-of-town guests. Mention Boxtoberfest to receive discounts when booking.
Contact: boxtoberfest.com ; lodging details: rioranchonm.org/blackbox .
